thread.title: Heritage to punish Republicans for voting to repeal Obamacare
thread.title_full: Heritage to punish Republicans for voting to repeal Obamacare | Washington Examiner

author: Paige Winfield Cunningham
title: Heritage to punish Republicans for voting to repeal Obamacare
text:
Heritage Action is threatening to punish Republicans if they vote for a measure repealing much, but not all, of Obamacare.
The conservative group, led by former Sen. Jim DeMint, said Tuesday it will "key vote" a bill the House is poised to take up that ditches the law's individual and employer mandates, a number of the law's taxes and several other components, including an independent panel to cut Medicare costs.
That's because the bill doesn't fully repeal the Affordable Care Act, due to legislative rules known as budget reconciliation. By using the reconciliation process to get rid of the healthcare law they hate, Republicans only have to gain a simple majority of Senate votes. But under those rules, only provisions that are tied to spending can be included in the measure.
Related Story: http://www.washingtonexaminer.com/article/2574118/ While congressional aides say it's impossible to repeal certain parts of the healthcare law, such as its insurance regulations, using budget reconciliation rules, Heritage Action is disputing that. The group is insisting that Republicans are denying that the full law can be repealed, and it is threatening to count a vote for the reconciliation bill against members.
  Webb drops out, considers independent run "I'm stepping aside from the Democratic primary process," Webb said.
  1:21 PM "House Republican leaders are putting their members in a terrible position," said Heritage Action communications director Dan Holler. "This bill will not restore Americans' health+care freedom because it leaves the main pillars of the law in place. GOP leaders are violating an explicit promise made in the budget and walking back on their public commitment to fully repeal Obamacare. By doing so they are undermining any serious effort to repeal the law in 2017."
Policy experts agree that using budget reconciliation rules to repeal Obamacare is Republicans' best chance to put a repeal bill on President Obama's desk, even though the president is virtually guaranteed to veto it.
The move by Heritage complicates the effort, as it puts pressure on conservatives to vote against a bill they had otherwise been enthusiastic about. And by punishing Republicans, Heritage may inadvertantly praise Democrats, who plan to vote against reconciliation because they support the healthcare law. Holler wouldn't tell the Washington Examiner whether Democrats will get a positive score from Heritage for opposing the bill.
"Sometimes folks vote the right way for the wrong reason," he said.
Also from the Washington Examiner U.N. chief calls for peace in Israel Ban Ki-Moon visited Jerusalem to talk to Israeli and Palestinian leaders about reducing violence.
